docs.snippet: An Atlanta mother who volunteers to help a refugee family discovers that the need, and the benefit, goes both ways.
"Farmville" creator Zynga Inc on Thursday appointed Gerard Griffin as its chief financial officer, adding another Electronic Arts Inc executive to its top ranks.

headline.print_headline: 'Farmville' Creator Zynga Names Former EA Executive CFO
headline.main: 'Farmville' Creator Zynga Names Former EA Executive CFO

docs.snippet: Mr. Gentiloni hopes to lead Italy out of a political crisis that ensued with the recent resignation of Matteo Renzi as prime minister.

headline.print_headline: Minister Will Try to Form New Government in Italy
headline.main: Paolo Gentiloni, Italy’s Foreign Minister, Will Try to Form a New Government

docs.snippet: On this week’s Modern Love podcast, the “Transparent” actress tells the story of how a missed flight leads a woman to weigh the pros and cons of marriage.

headline.main: The Modern Love Podcast: Kathryn Hahn Reads ‘The Wedding Toast I’ll Never Give’

docs.snippet: The Navy has investigated the case of a sailor who didn't salute as the national anthem played during a recent morning flag-raising at Pearl Harbor.

headline.main: Navy Investigates Sailor Who Didn't Salute National Anthem

docs.snippet: Google’s new chat app promises to stand out from a crowded field by bringing artificial intelligence into conversations. But it turns out to be frustrating and unhelpful.

headline.print_headline: Trying Out Allo, Google’s Annoying Office Intern
headline.main: Allo’s Tryout: 5 Days With Google’s Annoying Office Intern

docs.abstract: Tech Fix column; Google's messaging app Allo, which lets people use artificial intelligence to chat and make plans, is like annoying office intern.

docs.snippet: The bride and groom work at Facebook.
A woman performing the national anthem before an NBA preseason game in Miami did so while kneeling at midcourt.

headline.print_headline: Anthem Singer at Heat-76ers Game Kneels During Performance
headline.main: Anthem Singer at Heat-76ers Game Kneels During Performance

docs.snippet: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate the mechanics of the Trump transition, women’s gestures of political solidarity and athlete activism.

docs.snippet: Spanish, German and Belgian authorities have arrested five people suspected of forming an "active and dangerous" Islamic State cell and promoting Islamist militancy in the three countries, Spain's interior ministry said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Five Arrested on Suspicion of Forming European Islamic State Cell
headline.main: Five Arrested on Suspicion of Forming European Islamic State Cell
